damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

wargear.description: The bearer is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.
wargear.name: Battlesuit Support System

datasheets.fluff: Nothing so huge should be able to slip unnoticed across the battlefield, yet between its stealth field and its electrowarfare suite the Ghostkeel Battlesuit does just that. Once in position its pilot unleashes ferocious volleys of firepower, ambushing, overwhelming and scattering the terrified foe in a matter of moments.
datasheets.loadout: ■ This model is equipped with: cyclic ion raker; twin fusion blaster; Ghostkeel fists; battlesuit support system.
datasheets.name: Ghostkeel Battlesuit

wargear.description: The bearer’s unit has the Markerlight keyword and can act as an Observer unit for another unit even if it Advanced this turn.
wargear.name: Marker Drone

datasheets.fluff: A comparatively lightweight and specialist mark of battlesuit, the XV25 conceals its pilot behind fields of sensor-baffling stealth technology. Benefiting from jet-assisted speed and impressive firepower, these teams make excellent forward operatives.
datasheets.loadout:
■ 1 Stealth Shas’vre is equipped with: fusion blaster; battlesuit fists; battlesuit support system; marker drone.
■ 2 Stealth Shas’ui are equipped with: burst cannon; battlesuit fists.
datasheets.name: Stealth Battlesuits

datasheets.fluff: Specialists in infantry-based battlefield tactics, Cadre Fireblades eschew the honour of a battlesuit in order to fight selflessly amongst the Fire caste’s rank and file. Their veteran wisdom is of great benefit to the warriors alongside whom they fight, optimising the ferocity and accuracy of their firepower.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: Strike Team
datasheets.loadout: ■ This model is equipped with: Fireblade pulse rifle; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Shas’nel D’Tano

datasheets.fluff: Fire Warrior Strike Teams are the mainstay of many Hunter Cadres, unleashing storms of potent anti-personnel firepower that few foes can long endure. Tough, dependable, numerous and with access to a variety of specialised weaponry and drone support, these Fire Warriors will hold the line no matter what odds they face.
datasheets.loadout:
■ 1 Fire Warrior Shas’ui is equipped with: pulse carbine; pulse pistol; close combat weapon; support turret missile system; marker drone.
■ 5 Fire Warriors are equipped with: pulse pistol; pulse rifle; close combat weapon.
■ 4 Fire Warriors are equipped with: pulse carbine; pulse pistol; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Strike Team

wargear.description: The bearer can Fly and has a Move characteristic of 10".
wargear.name: Hover Drone

datasheets.fluff: Like all Ethereals, Aun’Shar is serene and wise, a spiritual leader of the T’au who embodies the unity of the Greater Good. In times of war he is ever keen to take to the field in person, fighting with his energised honour stave, skimming above the battle aboard his hover drone and invoking the fundamental might of the T’au castes.
datasheets.loadout: ■ This model is equipped with: honour stave; hover drone.
datasheets.name: Aun’Shar

enhancements.description: The bearer has the Lone Operative and Stealth abilities. While a friendly T’au Empire Infantry unit is within 6" of the bearer, improve the Save characteristic of models in that unit by 1 and those models have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.
enhancements.name: DS13 Experimental Drone (Aura)

enhancements.description: The bearer has the Lone Operative and Stealth abilities. While a friendly T’au Empire unit is within 6" of the bearer, ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
enhancements.name: DS15 Experimental Drone (Aura)

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PISTOL] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Warriors of the Fire caste train to keep selecting targets and gunning them down even as the foe close to point-blank range.
stratagems.name: Defensive Fusillade
stratagems.target: One T’au Empire unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move up to D6". If your unit has the Battlesuit keyword, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" instead.
stratagems.fluff: T’au military doctrine is highly mobile, placing little value on retaining territory compared to the preservation of T’au lives and the elimination of the enemy’s strength.
stratagems.name: Rapid Repositioning
stratagems.restrictions: Until the end of the turn, your unit is not eligible to declare a charge
stratagems.target: One T’au Empire unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

stratagems.effect: Your unit can shoot that enemy unit as if it were your Shooting phase. When doing so, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 6 is required to score a hit, irrespective of the attacking weapon’s Ballistic Skill or any modifiers. Until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: Painted with markerlights by well-hidden Pathfinders, the foe are perfectly triangulated ready to be cut down as they charge.
stratagems.name: Laser-Marked Targets
stratagems.restrictions: Your unit cannot shoot more than once this turn.
stratagems.target: One T’au Empire unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge and is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
